column5: Came down the 502 going south yesterday morning and as I was driving a black truck with no front plate but Wisconsin on the back pulled right up behind me and was in a hurry to pass. He passed me finally and blew by and was going at a good clip. Later on down by the S curve bridge on the south end of 502 there he was pulled over by the OPP. He will have a good fine.
Ya never know what's going to happen on the 502,it's the Heinz 57 road, a lot of things can happen on that road.
It didn't happen to have offset rims where the tires stick way out beyond the fender wells did it ?...........lol.
It might of had those tires. I know they had a rod case tied across their tonneau cover.
You are right. We almost took out a moose going up last week Friday. It crossed right in front of the truck and had to put the brakes on. About 3:30 in the morning.
The moose probably telling his buddies that he almost took out a truck!

Most of the local people wait until daylight to travel 502 because of the risk of hitting a moose. Moose are black and their eyes do not glow in headlights like a deer, hard to see until the last minute when driving at night, let alone on such a winding road.
